alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Boyle; Fayette; Garrard; Jessamine; Lincoln; Madison; Marion; Mercer; Washington; Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:23AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Lincoln, Mercer, southern Woodford, Garrard, southern Anderson, east central Marion, Jessamine, eastern Washington, Boyle, northwestern Madison and south central Fayette Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 523 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Lawrenceburg to 8 miles west of Harrodsburg to 8 miles southeast of Springfield. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Harrodsburg around 530 AM EDT. Danville around 535 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Nicholasville, Stanford, Lancaster and Veterans Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Boyle; Fayette; Garrard; Jessamine; Lincoln; Madison; Marion; Mercer; Washington; Woodford
